page.title: 03SANTON DOWNHAM VILLAGE
page.content: Santon Downham has a population of about 300 and is linked by a crescent shaped unclassified road to the B1107. There is some controversy over the name but it is basically Sand_tun_ village on sandy soil and Dun_ham_ village on a hill or slope, as the surrounding land is gently undulating between 5 and 50m. The village, prior to F.C. takeover, was a feudal estate system centred around Downham Hall, now demolished. The old buildings are mostly near the river, with F.C. housing stretched along the north side of the village green. The population is concerned that whereas attractions like Nature Trails bring many visitors, the plans for a commercial caravan site about 2 miles away will bring unwelcome intrusions.
